S.FORM: pisatapangan to a minanam, micomoday to ko singsi i laloma’ no pitilidan, “katomireng, mita’ong” sa ko kakeridan.
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: sata’angay sa ko ngiha niyam a pasowal to “nga’ay ho singsi.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: to pinanaman i, pasifana’en no singsi kami to sa’osi no ’Amis.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the ’Amis language of numbers.

S.FORM: todongan niyam ko pisa’osi no singsi, radiwan niyam ko sa’osi.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: adihay to ko kafana’an no mako to sowal no ’Amis.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many ’Amis languages.

S.FORM: mitilid kako to romi’ami’ad, minanam kako to sowal no ’Amis to romi’ami’ad, papitengilen ako ci ina to sowal ako.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the ’Amis language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ci Kacaw ko ngangan no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是kacaw。
My name is kacaw.

S.FORM: ci Asing ko ngangan no wama ako.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Asing。
My dad’s name is Asing.

S.FORM: ci Panay ko ngangan no wina ako.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Panay。
My mother’s name is Panay.

S.FORM: mo^tepay to ko mihecaan no mako anini.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: cecayay ko kaka ako, ci Kulas ko ngangan ningra, cecayay to ko safaw ko mihecaan ningra.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫kulas，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is kulas, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: malacecayay ko pitilidan niyam a mitilid.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: maolah kako aci kaka a romadiw.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: maolah kako a midangoy, paaliwacan i, malahakelong ko paro no loma’ niyam a midangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: maolah kako a misawidang to fa^lohay a widang, manga’ay kami a malacafay romadiw ato midangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: o wawa no ’Amis kako.
S.TRANSL: 我是阿美族的小孩。
I am an ’Amis child.

S.FORM: i Posongay ko loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在台東。
Our family lives in Posongay.

S.FORM: lalima ko paro no loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tatolo kami a malakaka.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: malacafay kako to wama, wina, kaka to fa’inayan ato kaka to fafahiyan a ma’orip.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: akawangay ko wama ako, o malatayxinay ko wama ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: mangiliway ko wina ako, o malaisingay ko wina ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: sano’Amisan no wama kami a caciyaw i loma’.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ’Amis language with us at home.

S.FORM: pa’aliwacan to kaciherangan i, minokay kami a talaniyaro’.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: malacafay kako to kaka to fa’inayan fafahiyan a mitakora’.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: maolah kako to paro no loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: masadakay kako aci ina a misalama anini.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: sa langdaw sa ko kakarayan to romo’ad, cowa kafa^det cowa kasi^naw, saemelay ko falifali.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: i rengorengosan kami a komaen to ^pang, mapaedil no cidal ko tatirengan, tada dihekoay.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: herek no lahok, masakahengangay to ko kakarayan.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: licay han ako ci ina, mana kahengang ko kakarayan.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: sowal sa ci ina, wa aira ko faliyos a tayni alatek.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: awaay ko to’em/kadit i kakarayan, masadakay to ko fo’is.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: wa maminokay to kami.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: i fatad no pinokayan a lalan, ira ko pinanay no faloco’ ako to fo’is.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: nanay aka ho katayni koni a faliyos, sakasadakan nanay ho kako a misalama.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: i tatihiay no loma’ ako ko pitilidan, saka rakat sanay kako a talapitilidan, rakat sanay kako a minokay to romi’ami’ad.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: cowa katata’ang ko pitilidan niyam, cowa ka’aloman ko mitiliday, sahto o kananaman to.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: cowa kata’angay ko pitilidan niyam, cowa ka’aloman ko mitiliday, sahto o kananaman to.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: mapolong ko kaemangay a masa’opo i kasa’opoan a malacecay ko pisalama kalalicay.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: mikihatiyaay ko singsi i tamiyanan a misalama, o ta’angyay to a laloma’an ko pitilidan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: miasikay to kami to romi’ami’ad, songila’en ita a miasik ko pitilidan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: misifin ko roma to sasingaran, miasik ko roma to paenan.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: mafana’ aca kami a miasik to tadimocomocok no pitilidan, mala’esal kita to tatayalen nga’ , makapah ko pitilidan to romi’ami’ad.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。

S.FORM: tayraay kako i niyaro’ a miliso’ ci akongan i nacila.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: halafinay to a ca kasaso’araw kami, ma’ilolay to kako i cingranan.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: paka’araw ci akong i takowanan, tangsol sa a pakaen i takowanan to kacawas, pananom to uciya i takowanan.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: ko^sanay ko nipalomaan ni akong a kacawasay, so^lin tada nga’ayay to a kaenen.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: maolahay kako to uciya ni akong, nga’ayay to a nanomen.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: kalahokan to i, malacafay kako aci mamoan a misakalahok.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: kadofah ko mitangtangan ni mamo a sakalahok, ira ko foting, koko’, tamorak ira ho ko katacomoli.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: kadofah ko mitangtangan ni mamo a sakalahok, ira ko foting, koko’, ciyak ira ho ko cori’.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: maherek a malahok i, tayraay kami i padatengan a midateng.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: adihayay ko mipafelian ni mamo i takowanan to mialaan ningra a konga, tali ato rakiw to hapapanokayen no mako.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: arayom han to ako cangra a pasowal to miliyaw ho kako a tayni miliso’ han ako.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: keridan no singsi kami a tayra i pi’arawan to pinanowang, masarayaray kami i fawahan a mi’aca to paya.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: micomod to kami i pinanowangan, sowal sa ko singsi, “o ’aya’ayaman ko i ka’ayaway, o ’oner’oneran ko kaikoray, pakoniyaniyah sa kita a mi’araw.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: matalaway kako to ’oner, saka cowa kapi’araw kako to ’oner.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: ma’araw ako ko adihayay a ’ayam misaefeefer cangra i kilakilangan, ma’araw ho ako ko ekong a mafoti’ i dihif.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: ira aca ko eco, efa ato lokdaw i pinanowangan, sahto sa o cowa ho ka’araw ako i ’ayaw ho, salipahak sa kako a paka’araw anini.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: adihayay ko nisasingan ako to hasapanengneng ci mamaan ci inaan.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: miliyaw i, hacafayen ako ci mama ci ina a tayni.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: tona pa’aliwacan a romi’ad, tayraay kako ato kaka ako to fafahiyan i Posong a miliso’ ci fakian.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: nani Taypak kami a mikalic to cinamalay a tayra i Posong.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: tahira sa to i Posong, pakapaliding ci faki a militemoh i tamiyanan.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: cowa karaay ko loma’ ni faki to siyataw, cahocaho tahiraay to.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: iraay ko cecay ta’angayay a pala to pipakaenan to ’a’adopan i ngata no loma’ ni faki, malacecay kami a mikoliciw a tayra.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: itira tora pipakaenan, keriden ni faki kami a mipakaen to siri a mikalic to efa.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: to dadaya to i, malacafay kami a tayra i maci a malafi.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: adihayay ko paliding i maci saka, pakaotopay sa kami a tayra.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: ya mamiliyas to kami i, matakaway ko otopay no niyam saka, pakapaso sa to kami a minokay.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: tahiniay to kami i Taypak anohatini, ya otopay ni faki i, maxeraay to hakiya!
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: itiniay i Posong ko loma’ niyam i kakaemangan ho, mitilid to haw i, mafolaway to a tayra i Taypak, aitira sanay to i tokay ko ’orip.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在台東，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Posong. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: mitilid to i ta’angayay a pitilidan i, minanamay kako tono serangawan no Yincomin, mafana’ to kako to kahirahira, kadofah no serangawan no Taywan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: saka, anini a mihecaan to pipa’aliwacan to kaciherangan, minokay kako ato kaka ako a tayra i niyaro’ a milicay to malitengay/mato’asay to sakafana’aw to serangawan no niyah a finacadan.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: faloay to a polo’ ko mihecaan nora mato’asay, nengneng han hato kaemangay ho.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: o manan manan a sowalan ko kafana’an iso a somowal han ako a milicay cingra, tanestesay ko sowal ningra tono ’Amis, mafana’ aca a somowal tono Piyoma, payrang ato no Dipong.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的阿美語說得很流利，也會說卑南語、閩南語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in ’Amis, as well as Pinuyumayan, Hokkien and Japanese.

S.FORM: licay han ako cingra a mafana’ kako, yo kaemang ho cingra i, minanamay to to sowal no Dipong, o Piyoma ko fafahi ningra, alomanay aca ko kananaman ningra a Payrang i katayalan saka, adihay ko kafana’an ningra a sowal.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是卑南族人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Pinuyumayan, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: itini to kalalicay niyam, adihay ko makitohay no mato’asay to pakiniay to fenek no mi’adopay.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: talacowa cowa katadafana’ kami a mitengil nika, tanotingwaan no niyam a misasing nga’, nga’ay ko pisaliyaliyaw no niyam a mitengil.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: cowa kafana’ kako to serangawan no niyah i kakaemangan ho, pakini to no niyah o Yencumin a tireng i, mangodoay to ko harateng.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: ikor to haw i, mafana’ to kako to tireng no niyah o ’Amis, o tadamaanay o micidekay, o kalita’angan to konini!
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為阿美族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a ’Amis is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: wa minokay to ko safa to fa’inayan anini to kakeremam.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: tayra kako aci mamo i cifa a mi’aca to koko’, misaday to ’aredetay a sakalafi to hano safa.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: mata’elif niyam ko paliwalay to dateng, adihay ko ko^ngelay a dateng to papaliwalen no paliwalay.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: o incay, korto ato ningcing ko mi’acaan niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: sowal sa koya tatihiay a tawki toya paliwalay to losay, “ko^sanay ko talacay ato lopas no mako, ’acaen ko pinapina makena!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: ’acaan to niyam ko talacay ato lopas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: mata’elif niyam ko paliwalay to titi, sowal sa koya tawki, “o manan ko ’a’acaen no miso? ta’angayay maso^so aca koni a koko’ anini, tolo a so’ot ko ’aca no cecay.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: ’atekakan nanay ci mamo, manga’ay a saka’emeden to mamang han nira koya tawki a milicay.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: nikawrira, ka’emeday to, caay to kanga’ay a lowanen sa ko sowal noya tawki.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: pasowal sa koya tatihiay a tawki, “katayni a mi’aca to foting ako, ta’angayay ka’emeday aca ko foting ako.”
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: ikor to i, ma’aca to niyam ko koko’ ato foting, minokay a tahaloma’ i, tangsol sa a mitangtang to cecay a ’eto a kakaenen.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: halafinay to ko pitatala, to’eman sa to ko romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: sa to’eman sa to ko romi’ad to pitatalaan.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: patingwa ko safa a pasowal, safana’sa a awa ko ’aliwac no sofitay sa, roma sa to a lipay to pa’aliwacan nga’ manga’ay a minokay saan.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: pasowal sa ci mamo, “adihayay to ko mitangtangan, tahidangen to ko ’alomanay a mitahka.”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: matahidang to niyam ko salawinawina ato widawidang a malacecay a mitahka tona kadofahay a sakalafi.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: iraay ko cecay a kapot ako ci Kacaw halitawalay cingra a mihawikid to kalimaamaan.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kacaw，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kacaw, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: to pinanaman i, micaliw cingra to impic, sararop anca o tilid no kapot.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: kinacecay, kinatosa, kinatolo pacaliwan to no ’alomanay cingra to kalimaamaan.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: nikawrira iraay koya tati’ihay a pinangan ningra, mafana’ay a micaliw, mafokilay a patikol.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: saikor to i, cowa to kakahi a pacaliw ko ’alomanay i cingranan.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: yo cecay a romi’ad, mapolong kami a malacafay a misalama.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: i fatad no lalan, ka’enihay ci Kacaw, nikawrira matawal ningra ko sa’ilos.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Kacaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kacaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: micaliw cingra to sa’ilos i kapokapotan, cowa kapihawikid kako han no ’alomanay cingra a pasowal.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

S.FORM: tangic sato ci Kacaw to caroh ningra. keter sa a somowal, “mana cowa kakahi kamo a pacaliw i takowanan to sa’ilos!”
S.TRANSL: Kacaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Kacaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: pakafana’ han no kapot cingra, cowa kapihawikid kiso to no miso, ya mipacaliwan i tisowanan a dafong i, cowa ho kapatikolen iso.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: to roma sa to a romi’ad a mitilid, pacerem ci Kacaw a talapitilidan, ya micalwan ho ni Kacaw a dafong i, patikolen to ningra ko kapot.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Kacaw很早就到學校了，Kacaw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kacaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: ta’ong han to ni Kacaw ko kapokapot a pasowal, ikor to haw i, mihawikid to cingra to no niyah to a dafong, miaray aca cingra to pipacaliw no kapot i cingraan i ’ayaw.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
kacaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: o mi’adopay a tamdaw ko wama ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: yo kaemang ho kako, mihawikid ci ama aci faki to fonos ato kowang a malingad to dadaya.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: kanikaran to i, mapanokay to nangra ko tama’ a minokay.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: to roma i, o fafoy anca o lawal, latekay ira ko tolok.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: misilsil cangra to tama’ i ’adawang, palilamen nangra ko finawlan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: micaraan to ako ci ama, mi’ocil a malahakelong ci wamaan a mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: ta’angay to kiso nga’ keriden ako kiso sa ci ama i takowanan.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: to sakanga’ayaw no mako a mitoor to mato’asay a mi’adop, milisiw kako a misanga’ to talakal , so’elin narikay a citama’ to ’a’adopen ko talakal no mako.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practice making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: paka’araw ci ama, sowal sa i takowanan, cowa kaeca o mamalasaidahiay a mi’adopay a tamdaw kiso sa.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: mato’as to kako, koyoden to ako ko focol ato pana’ a mihakelong ci amaan a mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: ano patatikol to i niyaro’ i, wapalilamen ko finawlan to tama’ no pi’adop ako.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: sowal sa ci ama, “kansiyaen ita ko palemed no to’as, adihay ko kinaira ita a mi’adop.”
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: Maapac kako to dafak a talapitilidan.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: Matawal ako mihawikid to, kafang a talapitilidan.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: Awaawaay ko mihawikidan ako.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: Misatapang to a minanam, malacafay a minengneng to codad kako ato kapot ako.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: Misatapang to a miseking, pacaliw ko kapot to impic ato sararop i takowanan.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: Sowal sa ko singsi i takowanan “karatar to a lomowad, aka to kaapac!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Sanga’ayay a widang ako ci Kacaw, o wawa no Pangcah cingra.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Kacaw，他也是阿美族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Kacaw, and he is also an Amis child.

S.FORM: Malacafay kami a mitilid i Tafalong a niyaro’.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在太巴塱部落讀書。
We study together in the Tafalong tribe.

S.FORM: Pararid kami a malacecay mitengil to ko pikimad no mato’asay, tadamafana’ to kami a caciyaw to sowal no Pangcah.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說阿美語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Amis proficiently.

S.FORM: Takaraw a masoeso kako, poener a makoli ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Kacaw很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Kacaw is short and thin.

S.FORM: Tada tariktikay ci Kacaw, maolah kami cingraan a mapolong.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Kacaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: O piongtokay no pitilidan a romi’ad anini, adihay ko lalifeten no pitilidan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: Ira ko masasolotay, micokaray to mali, comikayay, masakeroay ato mipana’ay.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: O comikayay ko milifetan ako.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: Yo comikayay ho kako i, matolo’ay, mare:mesay ko tosor ako.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: Na lomowad kako, lingatoen ako comikay a tala’ayaw.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: Tahira to kako i pasetokan malipahak ko polong a maemin.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: Talacowa awa maala ko sakacecay, nikaorira mahemekay to kako, hawhani malaheci to ako ko pilalifetan.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: Talamiliso’ ci fakian kako ato ci mama ako inacila.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和我爸爸去拜訪叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: Madoka’ ko wa’ay ni faki.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: Pasowal sa cingra i tamiyanan, ma’epong ko fadahong no loma’.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: Misanga’ ho cingra to fadahong i, nani fadahong a matefad.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂掉下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: Mihawikid ci mama to titi no kolong ato ’icep a pafeli ci fakian.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: Miholol kako ato ci faki i kafoti’an, adihay ko mipalada’an ningra a kimad.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: I’ayaw no piliyas ako, malata’ang ci faki i takowanan, takaraw to a tanektek to saan.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: Sowal han nako “maadah to ko wa’ay ni faki, liyaw han tayni misalama i loma’ niyam.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: Itini i tosa patek tosa polo’ ira ko tosa a mihecaan i, mikayki ko sifo to sakacipinang no tireng no Yin-cu-min a manga’ay micidek to ngangan no finacadan a kayki.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: Milicay kako to matenesay misi’ayaway to sifo a milongoc to sakacipinang no tireng “micidek to ngangan no finacadan” a kapah no niyaro’ ci Foting Mayaw.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年 Foting Mayaw。
I interviewed Foting Mayaw, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: Masasowal to kami a tayra i loma’ ningra malalicay cingraan toni a pa’aliwacan.
S.TRANSL: 我們約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: Malalicay ho i, pasifana’en ningra kako to na icowaay ko lalengawan no ngangan ningra, pasifana’en ningra kako to paro no loma’ ningra, o niyaro’ ningra.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，他也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: Licay han ako cingraan ano pacici han a mifalic to ngangan, tati’ih ko katelangay a pasingsi hayda?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: Sowal saan cingra i takowanan, nawhani o tilid no holam caay ka polita a pakafana’ to ngangan ningra, maceli’ ho no roma a tamdaw cingraan ci Fo先生 sanay, orasaka ira to ko adihayay a tatawaen masadak.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Fu Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Sowal sa ci Foting Mayaw, “o tilid no sowal no Yin-cu-min a ngangan i, o tadaso’elinay a ngangan no mita. O ngangan no mako i, o citodongay to finacadan no mita, laloma’an no mita, pinangan no tireng no mita, nanay ira ko ’aloman a ’aloman ko finawlan manga’ay patatikol to ngangan no niyah.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Foting Mayaw said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: Mitoor kako ci amaan inacila tayra i icifa a pa’aca, adihay ko mihawikidan mipalomaan ni ama to dateng a tayra, ira ko misanga’an kaeso’ay a kakaenen no Pangcah a pafeli to ’alomanay.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民(阿美族)美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: Maolah ko polong to pipa’acaan ni ama, ’aloman ko mi’acaay to damdam ato kakorot, ’aloman ko tayniay mitanam to mitangtangan ningra a kakaenen.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: Tadakaeso’ay ko mitangtangan ningra to lokot ato hakhak, ira ho ko mapacamolay to linnalo a kohaw no tefo’, masolot no sanek ko ’alomanay a lafang, misarayaray to polong a tayni i pipa’acaan niyam.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的山蘇和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用醃肉煮的竹筍湯，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: Mitangtang ho ci ama i, miholol kako to lafang i tatihi. ’ang’ang han ako i tatihi “o mipalomaan niyam ko dateng, awaay ko sapaiyo, kalamkamen a tayni mi’aca yo!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: Harakat a maemin mapa’aca ko papa’acaen niyam, sowal sa ci ama “nanay saheto kiso iraay ho ko pipadang.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, It's all thanks to your help.""

S.FORM: Oni a demak i, mafana’ to kako to nai pinalengaw no Yin-cu-min ato kakaenen a fenek, roma sato matinako to ko roray no mipa’acaay.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: Ma’araw ko kinaolah ni ama to nai litengay a kakaenen, tada malata’ang ato mahemek ko faloco’ ako.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
